entry.title: Expats: Stop whining about Belgium and start voting
entry.content:
Expats: Stop whining about Belgium and start voting

Many of the people who don’t vote in local elections are political obsessives who fret about the EU’s democratic deficit. But the turn a blind eye to Brussels’ democratic deficit.

Thursday, 25 July 2024

entry.title: Gaia campaigns for ban on crushing and gassing chicks
entry.content:
Gaia campaigns for ban on crushing and gassing chicks

About 24 million male chicks are gassed and crushed each year in Belgium, says Gaia, calling on Belgians to join its campaign to have such practices banned.

Tuesday, 23 July 2024

entry.title: House in Molenbeek-Saint-Jean goes up in flames
entry.content:
House in Molenbeek-Saint-Jean goes up in flames

A house on Intendant Street, Molenbeek-Saint-Jean, was completely destroyed by fire on Monday afternoon. Four children had to be rushed to hospital.

Tuesday, 23 July 2024

entry.title: Brussels unveils first step in 'master-plan' to make European Quarter greener
entry.content:
Brussels unveils first step in 'master-plan' to make European Quarter greener

The redevelopment is part of a broader vision to make the European Quarter a 'lively and mixed neighbourhood'

Sunday, 21 July 2024

entry.title: The Coudenberg Palace: Once the grandest seat in Europe
entry.content:
The Coudenberg Palace: Once the grandest seat in Europe

The residence, known as the Coudenberg Palace, was the seat of counts, dukes, regents, kings and emperors. It was the pride of Brussels.

Wednesday, 17 July 2024

entry.title: Man stabbed in Schaerbeek on Monday evening
entry.content:
Man stabbed in Schaerbeek on Monday evening

The investigation is ongoing.

Tuesday, 16 July 2024

entry.title: Three young knife-attack suspects detained in Brussels
entry.content:
Three young knife-attack suspects detained in Brussels

Three minors suspected of committing a knife attack in a Brussels train are placed in a juvenile detention centre.

Monday, 15 July 2024

entry.title: Brussels rubbish collection: Route changes to optimise organic waste management
entry.content:
Brussels rubbish collection: Route changes to optimise organic waste management

The changes aim to reduce the mileage of collection vehicles as quantities of organic waste are surging – from 10,000 tonnes in 2022 to over 18,000 tonnes in 2023.

Monday, 15 July 2024

entry.title: Witnesses wanted for football hooligan vandalisation of central Brussels café
entry.content:
Witnesses wanted for football hooligan vandalisation of central Brussels café

Brussels police are appealing to the public for information over an incident in August 2022 when a group of Anderlecht fans trashed a well-known Art Deco café.

Wednesday, 3 July 2024

entry.title: Is Brussels the capital of solitude or where people escape loneliness?
entry.content:
Is Brussels the capital of solitude or where people escape loneliness?

Migrants are more prone to feelings of isolation. But with such a high density of expats, could Brussels also be the place where people escape from solitude?

Monday, 1 July 2024

entry.title: Brussels-Midi shooting: No arrests yet, victims of attack believed to be collateral
Brussels Finance Minister asks regional departments to cut budgets by 10%
entry.content:
Brussels Finance Minister asks regional departments to cut budgets by 10%

The request comes against the backdrop of an accelerating deterioration in the Brussels-Capital Region's finances.

Tuesday, 18 June 2024

entry.title: Tourist stays in Brussels up 15% but still below pre-pandemic levels
entry.content:
Tourist stays in Brussels up 15% but still below pre-pandemic levels

There were some 7.17 million overnight stays by tourists in Brussels last year

Tuesday, 18 June 2024

entry.title: Bertin Mampaka (MR) to preside over opening session of Brussels Parliament
entry.content:
Bertin Mampaka (MR) to preside over opening session of Brussels Parliament

As the oldest among those elected, Mampaka will chair the inaugural session of the Brussels Parliament later this month.

Monday, 17 June 2024

entry.title: New bouldering centre comes to Brussels
'Informal' EU summit: Traffic disruption expected in Brussels on Monday
entry.content:
'Informal' EU summit: Traffic disruption expected in Brussels on Monday

Police have warned people commuting in and to Brussels to expect traffic disruptions.

Monday, 17 June 2024

entry.title: One person injured in shooting near drug 'hotspot' Peterbos
entry.content:
One person injured in shooting near drug 'hotspot' Peterbos

One person was wounded in the shooting in the infamous Peterbos neighbourhood, one of the 15 "drug hotspots" in Brussels.

Sunday, 16 June 2024

entry.title: Some 4,500 people marched against far-right in Brussels
entry.content:
Some 4,500 people marched against far-right in Brussels

Organisers of the demonstration, which saw thousands take to Brussels' streets, expressed concern about the "alarming" normalisation of far-right discourse.

Sunday, 16 June 2024

entry.title: Some 6,000 cyclists took part in BXL TOUR, Tour of Belgium sprint kicks off
entry.content:
Some 6,000 cyclists took part in BXL TOUR, Tour of Belgium sprint kicks off

Most of the roads and tunnels that were shut off for the BXL Tour this morning reopened, but the fifth stage of the Tour of Belgium will cause disruption in the North.

Sunday, 16 June 2024

entry.title: Open-air cinema, DJ sets and yoga: Vaux Hall open for summer
